annotations: Patient John Doe, born on 05/10/1978, was admitted on 04/25/2024 under the care of Dr. Jane Smith, with a diagnosis of acute myocardial infarction. His medical history includes hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus, managed with Lisinopril, Atorvastatin, and Metformin. He has no known drug allergies and is a non-smoker with occasional alcohol use. Vital signs on admission revealed elevated blood pressure and heart rate. Treatment includes antiplatelet and anticoagulation therapy with aspirin, clopidogrel, and heparin, and scheduled cardiac catheterization. Consultations were requested from cardiology and endocrinology for further management.
